titleStmt.title: A letter of advice, from a secluded Member of the House of Commons, to his Excellency, Thomas Lord Fairfax, to admonish him of the Kings danger, his own duty, and the sad consequence of oppression and tyranny. All whose extremes are onely to be avoided by His Majesties safety, and the defence of his royall person and honor. / Delivered on Saturday Decemb. 30.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Edward, fl. 1640-1660.

titleStmt.title: A letter of advice, from a secluded Member of the House of Commons, to his Excellency, Thomas Lord Fairfax, to admonish him of the Kings danger, his own duty, and the sad consequence of oppression and tyranny. All whose extremes are onely to be avoided by His Majesties safety, and the defence of his royall person and honor. / Delivered on Saturday Decemb. 30.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Edward, fl. 1640-1660.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: E.S., i.e. Edward Stephens. Cf. Underdown, D. "Pride's Purge", p. 194.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
